title: NPC Livestreams
material_description: Digital sreen recording of @it's_yagirl_lyric Tiktok feed
brief_description: Spike Jonze’s Her has nothing on the latest Tiktok trend: NPC Livestreaming. Developed by Canadian streamer Fedha Sinon, AKA Pinkydoll, this trend has streamers imitating the repetitive, hyperreal behaviours of a videogame background character. Pinkydoll mimics the surreal quality of interacting with a videogame character, with a mechanical consistency to her movements and vocal tone as she repeats catch phrases in response to donations from loyal viewers. As gifts pour in, she delivers these responses in rapid-fire, perfectly imitating the uncanny valley effect of a computer-generated interaction. Most uncanny of all is her ability to maintain the persona for hours at a time, allegedly earning her $2-4000 per livestream.
description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Spike Jonze’s Her has nothing on the latest Tiktok trend: NPC Livestreaming. Developed by Canadian streamer Fedha Sinon, AKA Pinkydoll, streamers imitate the hyperreal behaviour of a videogame background character. In this video, Pinkydoll performs with a mechanical consistency to her movements and voice as she repeats catch phrases in response to viewer donations. As gifts pour in, she delivers responses in rapid-fire, perfectly imitating the uncanny valley effect of a computer-generated interaction. Most uncanny of all is her ability to maintain the persona for hours at a time, allegedly earning her $2-4000 per livestream.
